page.title: 01PUDSEY - GAZETTEER
page.content: { }PUDSEY(pop.32,000) lies 4 miles east of Bradford and 6 miles west of Leeds and is the focal point of this block.It was previously a municipal borough (1899),absorbing the nearby villages of Farsley and Calverley in 1937.It is now part of the Leeds Metro District Council,but its inhabitants still identify PUDSEY as their hometown. PUDSEY is typical of many small Yorkshire towns,being mainly stone- built with later developments in red brick.It lives up to the 'Dark Satanic Mills' image with about 20 mills dotted around the area.Many of these mills are no longer used to produce cloth but now have other uses.Despite its industrial past there is much very beautiful countryside within easy reach.The Yorkshire Dales are only 30 minutes away by car.
